item.title: Time for a New Engine
item.description: I decided to build (Un)focused Dev in WordPress, thinking that doing so would make me do a lot more WordPress dev. I was wrong. All it did was frustrate me, much like I thought it would. ðŸ˜† So I’m back in Staticland, this time using Netlify and Hugo. I get to work using the JAMStack, a way of working I’m pretty stoked about. Things around here are a bit broken right now, as I figure out silly things like “where’d my images go when I zapped them from Digital Ocean?

item.title: Quick update: IndieWeb Summit 2017
item.description: Just signed up for IndieWeb Summit 2017, and you can too over at 2017.indieweb.org. ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰ Or should I say…. RSVP yes to IndieWeb Summit 2017! More info soon — I just heard about this today! p.s. Not only that, but uh oh, here I am learning about IndieWeb RSVP syntax (see above). Ruh ro. More rabbit holes to fall down! ðŸ˜„

item.title: What Iâ€™ve been doing; or, what if you start a project and it kinda takes off but doesnâ€™t; or, what if it seems like you abandoned your own thing; or, integrating new practices; or, Day 36 to Day 64
item.description: For the first 5 weeks or so of 2017, I committed a whole lot to my #100DaysOfHealthing repo. The project buzzed around my head, I set up my work computer to launch Git Bash every day when I logged in, and folks that I admire even added me to their own projects. And then hey look at that, it was February, and a lot of good things were happening in my personal life–health things shaking out, finances slowly but kinda surely improving, meditating every day (not just three minutes at a time, but 10 minutes, even!

item.title: 100 Days of Healthing
item.description: 100 Days of Healthing What’s this, now? Inspired by 100DaysofCode, 100 Days of Healthing is a challenge to spend an hour a day, for 100 days, working on your health & self care. It’s permission to give yourself an hour a day. And we’re all here with you. Why do you hate 100 Days of Code? Oh my goodness, that’s so not true! I don’t. I think it’s a fabulous concept, super motivating, something I want to do (maybe for the second 100 days of 2017?

item.title: Starting a New WordPress Blog With Digital Ocean
item.description: Starting a New WordPress Blog With Digital Ocean I launched this today and I did it with a few hours worth of work. Some considerations: I’m actually super into jekyll and static site generators in general. However, I’m going to be helping with a project soon that might use WordPress, and I’m also pretty interested in it in general. So, here we go! I’m comfy using tutorials for command line stuff.
